item.title: Highlights and Facets for Visualizing Categorical Data
item.description: Side-by-Side Comparison of (a) Generic Plot and (b) Faceted Plots with Highlight Visualizing Categorical Data What’s the most effective way to visualize comparisons between variable factors? How do you share a lot of information without muddying up your visualizations? There definitely isn’t one answer, but here’s one solution: faceted plots with gghighlight. For sample data, I’m setting up two normal curves with offset sample means x̄ = ± 2. While we’re using two factors for simplicity, this method actual becomes more effective when the number of factors increases.
